docs.title: 5G NR
docs.text: 5G NR: SIB1 and gNodeB Identity (gNB ID) Length NR Cell Global Identity and NR Cell Identity Structure

docs.title: Default
docs.text:
NETWORK_TYPE;MCC;MNC;LAC;CID;PSC;CHANNEL;LATITUDE;LONGITUDE;ACCURACY;DESCRIPTION

Parameter Type Description Import NETWORK_TYPE String C (CDMA), G (GSM), W (WCDMA), T (TDSCDMA), L (LTE), N (5G NR) Mandatory for CDMA MCC String 3 digits Mandatory MNC String 2 or 3 digits Mandatory LAC Int NID (CDMA), LAC (GSM, WCDMA, TDSCDMA), TAC (LTE, 5G NR) Mandatory CID Long BID (CDMA), CID (GSM, WCDMA, TDSCDMA), CI (LTE), NCI (5G NR) Mandatory PSC Int SID (CDMA), BSIC (GSM), PSC (WCDMA), CPID (TDSCDMA), PCI (LTE, 5G NR) Mandatory for CDMA CHANNEL Int ARFCN (GSM, 5G NR), UARFCN (WCDMA, TDSCDMA), EARFCN (LTE) LATITUDE Double [-90;90], . as separator LONGITUDE Double [-180;180], . as separator ACCURACY Int in meters DESCRIPTION String text

GSM: MCC = 262, MNC = 02, LAC = 510, CID = 9571, LATITUDE = -90.0, LONGITUDE = 180.0, ACCURACY = 100, DESCRIPTION = info G;262;02;510;9571;;;-90.0;180.0;100;info

LTE: MCC = 230, MNC = 01, LAC = 16464, CI = 1144587 (eNodeB = 4471, sector = 11), PCI = 49, EARFCN = 3025, LATITUDE = -90.0, LONGITUDE = 180.0, ACCURACY = 100, DESCRIPTION = info L;230;01;16464;1144587;49;3025;-90.0;180.0;100;info

docs.title: Clf v2.0
docs.text:
{CID}{LAC}{MCC}{MNC}<TAB>{DESCRIPTION}

Parameter Description CID 4 digits (hex) LAC 4 digits (hex) MCC 3 digits MNC 2 or 3 digits DESCRIPTION text, 100 characters

MCC = 262, MNC = 02, LAC = 510 (0x01FE), CID = 9571 (0x2563), DESCRIPTION = info 256301FE26202<TAB>info

docs.title: Clf v2.1
docs.text:
{CID}{LAC}{MCC}{MNC}<TAB>{DESCRIPTION}

Parameter Description CID 5 digits LAC 5 digits MCC 3 digits MNC 2 or 3 digits DESCRIPTION text, 100 characters

MCC = 262, MNC = 02, LAC = 510, CID = 9571, DESCRIPTION = info 095710051026202<TAB>info

docs.title: Clf v3.0 (hex)
docs.text:
MCCMNC;CID;LAC;RNC;POS-LAT;POS-LON;POS-RAT;DESCRIPTION;RFU

Parameter Description MCC 3 digits MNC 2 or 3 digits CID 4 digits (hex, 0x prefix) LAC 4 digits (hex, 0x prefix) RNC 4 digits (hex, 0x prefix), used only for WCDMA POS-LAT latitude [-90;90], . as separator POS-LON longitude [-180;180], . as separator POS-RAT always -1 DESCRIPTION text RFU always 0

MCC = 262, MNC = 02, LAC = 510, CID = 9571, LATITUDE = -90.0, LONGITUDE = 180.0, DESCRIPTION = info 26202;0x2563;0x01FE;0x0000;-90.0;180.0;-1;info;0

docs.title: Clf v3.0 (dec)
docs.text:
MCCMNC;CID;LAC;RNC;POS-LAT;POS-LON;POS-RAT;DESCRIPTION;RFU

Parameter Description MCC 3 digits MNC 2 or 3 digits CID 5 digits LAC 5 digits RNC 5 digits, used only for WCDMA POS-LAT latitude [-90;90], . as separator POS-LON longitude [-180;180], . as separator POS-RAT always -1 DESCRIPTION text RFU always 0

MCC = 262, MNC = 02, LAC = 510, CID = 9571, LATITUDE = -90.0, LONGITUDE = 180.0, DESCRIPTION = info 26202;09571;00510;00000;-90.0;180.0;-1;info;0

docs.title: Open databases of cell towers
docs.text:
• Mozilla Location Service (MLS)
  • OpenCellid

docs.title: Cell towers and cells are two different things
docs.text:
It is very rare that only one antenna emitting a 360-degree GSM signal is mounted on a physical cell tower. More often, several antennas are mounted on a cell tower, many of them having 3 or 4 per network access type (GPRS, UMTS, LTE...). In this case, each antenna serves one segment of the full 360 degrees circle. A sample cell tower, with each antennae emitting signals at 120 degrees, is shown here:

Cell tower with 3 cells, each with 120° angle

Imagine that many cell ID measurements have been collected, equally distributed in one of the pie slices. In this case, the average of all recorded GPS positions would be as indicated in the graph above (e.g. "centre of area 1"). This would then be the position reported by the service.

Active cell sector Actual cell sector coverage

Sector Number — Typical antenna pointing direction:

  1. — approximately N to NE;
  2. — 120° clockwise from 1 --- approximately SE to S;
  3. — 120° clockwise from 2 --- approximately W.

Omni-directional antennas — which are rare — may be assigned sector number 0.

Cell towers can have from 0 to 6 sectors. Most common is three sectors.

Sector layout and azimuth Example of expected 3 sector cell tower radio coverage

docs.title: 1.8.9 - February 2020
docs.text:
• Fixed signal strength issues
  • Added TD-SCDMA & 5G NR networks support (Android 10)
  • Added cell bandwidth info (Android 9)

docs.title: 1.7.13 - December 2019
docs.text: • Fixed geolocation loading for new cells

docs.text:

docs.text:
• Fixed OSM loading
  • Fixed theme switching

  • Bug fixing & improvements

docs.title: 1.6.44 - March 2019
docs.text:
• Restored imported cells export
  • Added possibility to hide neighboring cells from cell tab
  • Targeting Android 8.0, runtime permissions support
  • Bug fixing & improvements

docs.text:

docs.title: 1.4.52 - October 2017
docs.text:
• Fixed multisim support on SM-G532, SM-G615
  • Fixed crashes

docs.title: 1.4.44 - October 2017
docs.text:
• Added date to clf export filename
  • Added operators filter to log tab
  • Added saving channel number in db
  • Added geolocation caching in db
  • Added new translation
  • Fixed dbm calculation
  • Fixed Huawei missing cells issue
  • Fixed log & map tabs freeze on device rotation

docs.title: 1.3.164 - July 2017
docs.text:
• Multisim logic fixes
  • Blackberry fixes
  • 18:9 screen aspect ratio support

docs.title: 1.3.157 - April 2017
docs.text:
• Fixed issues with map loading when a lot of cells to display
  • Fixed issues in roaming
  • Markers count on map
  • Choose cell API version
  • New cell info data
  • Updated multi SIM support
  • Opening Phone Info from menu
  • Adjust cell signal in settings
  • Cell network type to log
  • Location provider is now used only if enabled in settings
  • My location on map based on cells only
  • Removed items in log using long tap
  • Possibility to remove ads
  • Privacy policy

docs.title: 1.2.15 - August 2016
docs.text:
• Added new multi sim devices support
  • Added MTK engineer mode option
  • Fixed Samsung autorestart issue
  • Fixed partial wake lock issue

docs.title: 1.1.27 - August 2015
docs.text:
• Added OSM offline map support
  • Fixed multi sim support on some devices
  • Fixed clf export 500 lines issue
  • Fixed bugs

docs.title: 1.0.64 - March 2015
docs.text:
• Material design support

  • 2 SIM support when possible
  • LTE support

  • Samsung multi window support

docs.title: 0.11.7 - March 2014

docs.title: 0.11.5 - November 2012

  • Fixed bugs

docs.title: 0.11 - July 2012
docs.text:
• Added WiFi access points screen

docs.title: 0.10 beta3 - August 2011
docs.text:
• Fixed bug with trace & debug log, now it is appended to an existing file
  • Added RNC value, can be disabled in settings, if it is wrong
  • Added sort by appearance in log tab
  • Signal strength can be displayed now as ASU (Active Set Update)
  • Google location update can be requested from log tab
  • FieldTest (service menu) can be launched from home tab, if it is available (HTC, LG, Samsung)

docs.title: 0.10 beta3 - August 2011
docs.text:
• Fixed Motorola Droid location overlay bug
  • Fixed import db
  • Added cell, signal, location changes logs

docs.title: 0.10 beta3 - July 2011
docs.text:
• Fixed Android 1.5 support
  • Google location request can be disabled
  • Added cell view in hex
  • Fixed db import
  • Location layout is not seen when GPS location request is disabled
  • Added email feedback send

docs.title: 0.10 beta2 - July 2011
docs.text:

  • Fixed some bugs
